title: Delhi Air Quality Drops To 'Very Poor', 311 Indians Deported From Mexico + More Top News
text:
Delhi Air Quality Drops To 'Very Poor', 311 Indians Deported From Mexico + More Top News

Delhi Air Quality Drops To 'Very Poor', 311 Indians Deported From Mexico + More Top News

Only a few weeks back, Delhiites were cheering the city's clear weather but in no time it has gotten worse. The Air Quality Index (AQI) has been rising on a daily basis. Dust and smog continued to envelop Delhi as the AQI fell to the 'very poor' category. Read more

Here's more top news of the day:

1) 311 Indians Deported From Mexico For Allegedly Trying To Enter US Illegally

The Mexican border with the US has been for long attracted migrants from the country, neighbouring Latin American countries and other countries around the world who are trying to enter America illegally. Read more

2) India's Priorities! Cow Numbers Increase By 18% While 90% Kids Go Hungry

Don't Miss 465 SHARES

India has been ranked 102 out of 117 countries, the lowest-ranked among South Asian countries and among Brics nations, in terms of severity of hunger by the Global Hunger Index 2019. Read more

3) Migratory Birds From Serbia & Europe, That Flock Delhi Sanctuaries, Missing Due To Severe Pollution

Vehicular pollution, construction dust and smoke from farmers burning crop stubble are considered to be some of the leading factors of air pollution in the growing city, apart from the yearly practice of stubble burning in neighbouring states. Read more

4) Driver Transporting Apple, Trader Among Three Non-Kashmiris Killed By Terrorists This Week, Puts Valley On The Edge

The first to be killed was Sharief Khan, a truck driver from Rajasthan. He was shot dead by two terrorists, including a suspected Pakistani national, in Shopian district of Jammu and Kashmir on Monday. Read more

5) For The First Time Ever, Parliamentary Committee To Empower Women Has No Man

In the past, the Parliamentary Committee on women’s empowerment has had men as members. However, in the latest development, for the first time ever, the committee is an all-women affair. Read more
